Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi was even more high‐strung than normal and walked about barking orders here and there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi was even more high-strung than normal and walked about barking orders here and there.

Steam (ST): Even though the sky was beginning to get dark, the servants moved hurriedly about.
Umineko Project (UP): Even though the sky was beginning to get dark, the servants moved hurriedly about.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though the sky was beginning to get dark, the servants moved hurriedly about.

Russian (RU): Хотя небо уже темнело, слуги всё спешили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo com o céu começando a escurecer, os serviçais moviam‐se apressados para fazer tudo.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明已过黄昏，天空也已开始变黑了，但佣人们却还在忙得团团转。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se iniziava a fare buio, i domestici continuavano ad andare di corsa.

Steam (ST): Tomorrow is the annual family conference.
Umineko Project (UP): Tomorrow would be the annual family conference.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Tomorrow is the annual family conference.
PC Japanese (JP): 明日は年に一度の親族会議だ。
Russian (RU): Завтра ежегодное семейное собрание.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Amanhã seria a conferência anual de família.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明天是一年一度的親族會議。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明天是一年一度的亲族会议。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Domani si terrà l'annuale conferenza di famiglia.

Steam (ST): It isn't particularly rare for each of the individual families to visit the island, but this is the only time that they all come together.
Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't particularly rare for the siblings' individual families to visit the island, but this was the only time that they would all come together.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It isn't particularly rare for each of the individual families to visit the island, but this is the only time that they all come together.
PC Japanese (JP): 個々の親族たちがそれぞれに島を訪れることは少なくはないが、全員が一度に揃うのはこの日だけ。
Russian (RU): Отдельные семьи нередко посещают остров, но все вместе они приезжают только в это время.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era incomum que as famílias de cada irmão fizessem visitas à ilha, mas essa era a única oportunidade que tinham de se reunirem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然親族們各自登島拜訪的事並不算少，但全體團聚一堂，就僅限於這一天了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然亲族们各自登岛拜访的事并不算少，但全体团聚一堂，就仅限于这一天了。

Steam (ST): It was the most important day of the year for both the Ushiromiya family and Rokkenjima.
Umineko Project (UP): It was the most important day of the year for both the Ushiromiya family and Rokkenjima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the most important day of the year for both the Ushiromiya family and Rokkenjima.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家にとって六軒島にとって、もっとも重要な日だった。
Russian (RU): Самый важный день в году как для семьи Уширомия, так и для Роккенджимы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era o dia mais importante do ano, tanto para a família Ushiromiya quanto para Rokkenjima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明天是對右代宮家來說、對六軒島來說，最最重要的一天。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明天是对右代宫家来说、对六轩岛来说，最最重要的一天。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era il giorno più importante dell'anno sia per la famiglia Ushiromiya che per Rokkenjima.

Steam (ST): Natsuhi, who was short-tempered on top of being high-strung, kept ordering that the servants redo this or that, since it really didn't look good after all. This would keep them going until late into the night.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi, who was short‐tempered on top of being high‐strung, kept issuing orders one after another, only to later change her mind or ask for the work to be done again, keeping the servants busy until late into the night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi, who was short-tempered on top of being high-strung, kept ordering that the servants redo this or that, since it really didn't look good after all. This would keep them going until late into the night.
PC Japanese (JP): 神経質で、その上、短気な夏妃は、あれやこれやと指示を出しては、やはり気に入らない、あるいはやり直しと、夜の遅くまで使用人たちを振り回す。
Russian (RU): Нацухи, несдержанная и нервная, продолжала приказывать слугам повторить то и это из‐за того, что выглядит всё‐таки недостаточно хорошо. Так продолжалось до поздней ночи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi, que além de agitada estava de pavio curto, continuou impondo ordens atrás de ordens, só para depois mudar de ideia e pedir para que o trabalho fosse refeito, mantendo os serviçais ocupados até tarde.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 神經質且性情急躁的夏妃，“這呀那呀”地下達指示，然後再“果然不中意”或“重新來過”，把傭人們折騰到了大半夜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 神经质且性情急躁的夏妃，“这呀那呀”地下达指示，然后再“果然不中意”或“重新来过”，把佣人们折腾到了大半夜。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi, che oltre ad essere tesissima aveva poca pazienza, continuava ad ordinare ai domestici di rifare questo o quello, siccome non era stato fatto bene. Questo li avrebbe tenuti occupati fino a notte fonda.

Steam (ST): Now that Shannon had many years of experience and Natsuhi had put her in a position of responsibility, she was called over many times to have strict orders showered on her...
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon now had many years of experience and Natsuhi had put her in a position of responsibility, which meant that she was frequently called over to be given all kinds of strict orders...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Now that Shannon had many years of experience and Natsuhi had put her in a position of responsibility, she was called over many times to have strict orders showered on her...
PC Japanese (JP): 今や、短くない年季を持つ紗音は、夏妃に責任ある立場だと見なされており、何かあるごとに呼び出されては、あれこれ厳しく命令をされていた…。
Russian (RU): Шаннон, у которой уже был многолетний опыт, Нацухи поставила в ответственное положение, поэтому её часто вызывали, чтобы высыпать на неё строгие приказы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon tinha agora muitos anos de experiência e Natsuhi a colocou em uma posição de responsabilidade, o que significa que ela era frequentemente chamada para receber todo tipo de ordem...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如今，工作時間已不算短的紗音，被夏妃視為了責任人，一有什麼事就會被夏妃叫去，被她“這呀那呀”地嚴加命令…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如今，工作时间已不算短的纱音，被夏妃视为了责任人，一有什么事就会被夏妃叫去，被她“这呀那呀”地严加命令…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ora che Shannon aveva molti anni d'esperienza e Natsuhi le ha concesso in un posto di responsabilità, veniva chiamata molte volte per ricevere ordini molto rigidi...

Steam (ST): So, when Shannon finished her shower and lay down on the bed in the servant waiting room, she fell asleep almost immediately...
Umineko Project (UP): So, when Shannon finished her shower and lay down on the bed in the servants' quarters, she fell into a deep sleep almost immediately......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, when Shannon finished her shower and lay down on the bed in the servant waiting room, she fell asleep almost immediately......
PC Japanese (JP): だから、疲労困憊の紗音は、シャワーを浴びて使用人控え室の床に就いてすぐに、深い眠りに落ちるのだった……。
Russian (RU): Когда Шаннон закончила принимать душ и легла на кровать в приёмной слуг, она почти сразу же уснула......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, quando Shannon terminou seu banho e deitou‐se na cama das acomodações dos serviçais, ela imediatamente caiu em um profundo sono......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，精疲力竭的紗音，淋浴後便躺倒在傭人等候室中的床上，馬上墜入了深深的夢鄉……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，精疲力竭的纱音，淋浴后便躺倒在佣人等候室中的床上，马上坠入了深深的梦乡……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, quando Shannon uscì dalla doccia e si gettò sul letto nella sala dei domestici, si addormentò quasi immediatamente...

Steam (ST): ...I can hear the sound of wind...coming from somewhere far away.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I can hear the sound of wind...coming from somewhere far away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……どこか遠くで、風の音が聞こえる。
Russian (RU): ......Я слышу шум ветра... откуда‐то издалека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu consigo ouvir o som do vento...vindo de um lugar muito distante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我聽到，從遠方某處傳來了風聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我听到，从远方某处传来了风声。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Posso sentire il suono del vento... venire da molto lontano.

Steam (ST): ...It's a bit different from the sound wind outside a room would make.
Umineko Project (UP): ............It's a bit different from the sound wind outside a room would make.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's a bit different from the sound wind outside a room would make.
PC Japanese (JP): …………外で風が吹き出したような音とは、少し違う。
Russian (RU): ......Он слегка отличается от шума ветра снаружи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............É um pouco diferente do som que o vento do lado de fora do quarto costuma fazer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………這與外面起風時的那種聲音稍有不同。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………这与外面起风时的那种声音稍有不同。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... È un po' diverso dal suono del vento al di fuori della stanza.

Steam (ST): It's almost as though...I'm sitting in a deck chair in the rose garden, turning over in my sleep, ...with the feel of the wind in my hair.
Umineko Project (UP): It's almost as though......I'm sitting in a deck chair in the rose garden, turning over in my sleep, ......with the feel of the wind in my hair.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It's almost as though......I'm sitting in a deck chair in the rose garden, turning over in my sleep, ......with the feel of the wind in my hair.
PC Japanese (JP): 何だかまるで、……私が薔薇庭園にでもデッキチェアを出して、それで転寝をしていて、髪を風に撫でられているかのような、……そんな感じ。
Russian (RU): Словно...... я сижу в шезлонге в розарии, переворачиваюсь во сне...... и чувствую ветер в волосах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É quase como se......eu estivesse sentada em uma espreguiçadeira no jardim de rosas, revirando‐me em meu sono, ......com a sensação do vento em meus cabelos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知怎的，這感覺簡直就像，……我把躺椅放到了玫瑰庭園，如同就此躺在躺椅上打盹，被風輕撫頭髮，……一般。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知怎的，这感觉简直就像，……我把躺椅放到了玫瑰庭园，如同就此躺在躺椅上打盹，被风轻抚头发，……一般。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È quasi come se... stessi sedendo nel giardino di rose, rigirandomi nel sonno... con il vento tra i capelli.

Steam (ST): That's right, the feel. ...This isn't a sound, it's a feeling.
Umineko Project (UP): That's right, the feel. ......This isn't a sound, it's a feeling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's right, the feel. ......This isn't a sound, it's a feeling.
PC Japanese (JP): そう、感じ。……音じゃなくて、感じ。
Russian (RU): Точно. ......Не звук, а чувство.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso mesmo, essa sensação. ......Não é um som, é uma sensação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對，是感覺。……它不是聲音，而是感覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对，是感觉。……它不是声音，而是感觉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Giusto, la sensazione. ... Questo non è un suono, è una sensazione.

Steam (ST): Then is this... a dream...?
Umineko Project (UP): Then is this......a dream......?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then is this... a dream......?
PC Japanese (JP): なら、これは、……夢………？
Russian (RU): Это...... сон?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então isso é......um sonho......?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi questo è... un sogno...?

Steam (ST): Just as I was about to accept this theory, ...I thought I heard someone talking to me.
Umineko Project (UP): Just as I was about to accept this theory, ......I thought I heard someone talking to me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): そう決め込もうとした時、……誰かが私に語りかけているような気がした。
Russian (RU): Как только я собралась принять своё предположение...... мне показалось, что со мной разговаривают.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando estava para aceitar essa teoria, ......eu pensei ter ouvido alguém falando comigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正當要就此斷定的時候，……我感到了，好像有誰在跟我說話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正当要就此断定的时候，……我感到了，好像有谁在跟我说话。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Proprio quando stavo per accettare questa teoria... pensai di aver sentito qualcuno che mi parlava.

Steam (ST): "My, my. It seems the work of a servant is just as boring as it ever was.
Umineko Project (UP): {m:-5:—}—My, my. It seems the work of a servant is just as boring as it ever was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ――My, my. It seems the work of a servant is just as boring as it ever was.
PC Japanese (JP): ——やれやれ。相も変わらず、使用人の仕事とは退屈であるな。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ――やれやれ。相も変わらず、使用人の仕事とは退屈であるな。
Russian (RU): {m:-5:—}‐О боже. Работа слуги всё такая же скучная.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {m:-5:—}—Ora, ora. Parece que o trabalho de serviçal continua mais chato do que nunca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ——哎呀哎呀。一如既往，傭人的工作好是乏味呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ——哎呀哎呀。一如既往，佣人的工作好是乏味呢。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ――Accidenti. Sembra che il lavoro di un domestico sia noioso come al solito.

Steam (ST): Not only boring, but difficult, strict, constraining, joyless...
Umineko Project (UP): Not only boring, but difficult, strict, constraining, joyless...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Not only boring, but difficult, strict, constraining, joyless...
PC Japanese (JP): 退屈だけならまだしも、楽でない上に厳しく、窮屈、何の喜びもない…。
Russian (RU): Не только скучная, но и трудная, строгая, ограничивающая, безрадостная...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não apenas chato, mas difícil, rigoroso, constrangedor, abatido...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 光是乏味那倒也罷了，既不輕鬆還管得嚴，毫無自由，沒有任何樂趣…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 光是乏味那倒也罢了，既不轻松还管得严，毫无自由，没有任何乐趣…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non solo noioso, ma difficile, rigido, pesante, senza emozioni...

Steam (ST): All you get in return for your years of service is some level of respect from the newer servants.
Umineko Project (UP): All you get in return for your years of service is some level of respect from the newer servants.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All you get in return for your years of service is some level of respect from the newer servants.
PC Japanese (JP): そなたへの見返りは、せいぜいその年季分程度の、後輩の幾ばくかの敬意だけ。
Russian (RU): В обмен на годы вашей службы вы получаете лишь определённый уровень уважения со стороны новых слуг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo o que ganha em troca dos seus anos de serviços é um respeito igual ao oferecido aos novos serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 給汝的回報，頂多也就只是與汝工作時間成正比的，後輩的些許敬意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 给汝的回报，顶多也就只是与汝工作时间成正比的，后辈的些许敬意。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tutto quello che guadagnate dopo anni di servizio è il rispetto dei domestici più giovani.

Steam (ST): And even that is far from sufficient to repay you for all the hard work you've done...
Umineko Project (UP): And even that is far from sufficient to repay you for all the hard work you've done...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And even that is far from sufficient to repay you for all the hard work you've done...
PC Japanese (JP): それさえも、そなたのこれまでの使用人としての労苦には、まったく見合いはしない…。
Russian (RU): И даже этого отнюдь не достаточно, чтобы отплатить вам за всю вашу тяжёлую работу...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E isso está muito longe de ser suficiente para recompensar todos os seus anos de trabalho duro...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而就連這個，都完全抵不上，汝一直以來作為傭人所受的辛勞…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而就连这个，都完全抵不上，汝一直以来作为佣人所受的辛劳…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E anche questo non basta minimamente a ripagarti del tuo duro lavoro...

Steam (ST): {a:c:"Why do you not tire of this life?"}
Umineko Project (UP): {a:c:"Do you not tire...of such a life?"}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): {a:c:"Why do you not tire of this life?"}
PC Japanese (JP): {a:c:「もういい加減、飽きはせぬか。その生活に。」}
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {a:c:「もういい加減、飽きはせぬか。その生活に」}
Russian (RU): {a:c:"Как ты не устала от такой жизни?"}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {a:c:"Você não cansa...dessa vidinha?"}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {a:c:「就不膩麼？過這種生活。」}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {a:c:「就不腻么？过这种生活。」}
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {a:c: "Perché non ti sbarazzi di questa vita?"}

Steam (ST): Huh? ...Who...?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Huh?... Chi...?

Steam (ST): She wasn't just imagining someone talking to her. ...She was shocked to find that it was real.
Umineko Project (UP): She wasn't just imagining someone talking to her. ......She was shocked to find that it was real.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 語りかけているような気がする、ではなく。……本当に誰かが語りかけてきて、驚く。
Russian (RU): Ей не просто казалось, что с ней разговаривают. ......Она была потрясена, поняв, что так и есть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não estava imaginando alguém falar com ela. ......Ela estava chocada ao descobrir que era real.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不是感覺有人在跟自己說話。……而是真的有誰在對自己講話，紗音嚇了一跳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不是感觉有人在跟自己说话。……而是真的有谁在对自己讲话，纱音吓了一跳。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non stava soltanto immaginando qualcuno che le parlasse. ... Era sconvolta dallo scoprire che era vero.

Steam (ST): When Shannon opened her eyes, ...she gulped.
Umineko Project (UP): When Shannon opened her eyes, ......she gulped.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Shannon opened her eyes, ...she gulped.
PC Japanese (JP): そして目を開いた時、……紗音は思わず、息を飲み込んだ。
Russian (RU): Открыв глаза...... Шаннон сглотнула.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Shannon abriu seus olhos, ......ela engoliu em seco.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後在她睜開眼睛時，……紗音不禁倒吸了一口氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后在她睁开眼睛时，……纱音不禁倒吸了一口气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando Shannon aprì gli occhi... deglutì.

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "...Th- This place......"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Q... Questo posto..."

Steam (ST): She couldn't say any more. ...She was literally stunned silent.
Umineko Project (UP): She couldn't say any more. .........She was literally stunned silent.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She couldn't say any more. ......She was literally stunned silent.
PC Japanese (JP): それ以上の言葉は出ない。………文字通りの、絶句。
Russian (RU): Она не смогла сказать больше...... и буквально остолбенела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não conseguiu dizer nada além disso. .........Ela literalmente ficou sem palavras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再也說不出別的話了。………一如字面意思的，啞口無言。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再也说不出别的话了。………一如字面意思的，哑口无言。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non poté dire altro. ... Rimase sconvolta.

Steam (ST): Shannon, who had been sleeping on a bed, ...was somehow in a rose garden.
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon, who had been sleeping on a bed, ......was somehow in a rose garden.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon, who had been sleeping on a bed, ......was somehow in a rose garden.
PC Japanese (JP): ベッドで寝ているはずの紗音はいつの間にか本当に、……薔薇庭園にいた。
Russian (RU): Шаннон, спавшая на кровати...... очутилась в розарии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon, quem estava dormindo em sua cama, ......de alguma forma estava no jardim de rosas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 本應睡在床上的紗音，在不知不覺之間，……真的到了玫瑰庭園。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 本应睡在床上的纱音，在不知不觉之间，……真的到了玫瑰庭园。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Shannon, che stava dormendo in un letto... era finita in qualche modo in un giardino di rose.

Steam (ST): However, though this rose garden somehow resembled the rose garden on Rokkenjima, it was also completely different.
Umineko Project (UP): However, though this rose garden somehow resembled the rose garden on Rokkenjima, it was also completely different.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, though this rose garden somehow resembled the rose garden on Rokkenjima, it was also completely different.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしその薔薇庭園は、六軒島の薔薇庭園とどことなく似ていながらも、まったく違うものだった。
Russian (RU): Он напоминал розарий на Роккенджиме, но также и совершенно отличался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, embora este jardim de rosas pudesse lembrar o jardim de rosas de Rokkenjima, ele também era completamente diferente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只不過這個玫瑰庭園，儘管說不出來地相似，卻又與六軒島的玫瑰庭園完全不同。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只不过这个玫瑰庭园，尽管说不出来地相似，却又与六轩岛的玫瑰庭园完全不同。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, anche se questo giardino rassomigliava quello di Rokkenjima, era completamente diverso.

Steam (ST): After all, ...the roses were golden. And it wasn't just the flowers, but the dancing butterflies too.
Umineko Project (UP): After all, ......the roses were golden.{n}Not only the flowers, but the dancing butterflies too.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, ......the roses were golden. Not only the flowers, but the dancing butterflies too.
PC Japanese (JP): なぜなら、……薔薇が、黄金なのだ。薔薇が黄金ならば、舞う蝶もまた、黄金。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): なぜなら、……薔薇が、黄金なのだ。{n}薔薇が黄金ならば、舞う蝶もまた、黄金。
Russian (RU): Ведь...... розы были золотыми.{n}Не только цветы, но и кружащие бабочки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Até porque ......as rosas eram douradas.{n}Não apenas as flores, mas as dançantes borboletas também.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要問為什麼的話，……這是因為，玫瑰，是金色的。{n}既然玫瑰是金色的，那飛舞在空中的蝴蝶也同樣是金色的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要问为什么的话，……这是因为，玫瑰，是金色的。{n}既然玫瑰是金色的，那飞舞在空中的蝴蝶也同样是金色的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dopotutto... le rose erano dorate. Non solo i fiori, ma anche le farfalle che vi danzavano.

Steam (ST): It was a golden rose garden of mysterious beauty.
Umineko Project (UP): It was a golden rose garden of mysterious beauty.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a golden rose garden of mysterious beauty.
PC Japanese (JP): 神秘的な美しさの、黄金の薔薇庭園。
Russian (RU): Золотой розарий потусторонней красоты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um jardim de rosas douradas de misteriosa beleza.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是個，具有神秘美的黃金玫瑰庭園。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是个，具有神秘美的黄金玫瑰庭园。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era un giardino di rose dorate di una bellezza misteriosa.

Steam (ST): Somehow, Shannon was sitting in a chair under the arbor. It was as though she'd taken a nap there and woken up from a dream.
Umineko Project (UP): Somehow, Shannon was sitting in the chair under the arbor.{n}It was as though she'd taken a nap there and woken up from a dream.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Somehow, Shannon was sitting in the chair under the arbor. It was as though she'd taken a nap there and woken up from a dream.
PC Japanese (JP): その東屋の椅子に、紗音はいつの間にか座っていたのだ。まるでそこで居眠りをしていて、夢から覚めたかのように。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その東屋の椅子に、紗音はいつの間にか座っていたのだ。{n}まるでそこで居眠りをしていて、夢から覚めたかのように。
Russian (RU): Шаннон сидела на стуле в беседке.{n}Словно заснула там и пробудилась ото сна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De alguma forma, Shannon estava sentada em uma cadeira debaixo do gazebo.{n}Como se ela tivesse tirado um cochilo ali e acordado de um sonho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從不知何時起，紗音坐在了那間亭子的椅子上。{n}這就恰似，她在那打著瞌睡，從夢中醒來一般。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从不知何时起，纱音坐在了那间亭子的椅子上。{n}这就恰似，她在那打着瞌睡，从梦中醒来一般。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per qualche motivo, Shannon era seduta su una sedia sotto il pergolato. {n}Era come se si fosse appisolata lì e si fosse svegliata da un sogno.

Steam (ST): ...But it felt strange.
Umineko Project (UP): ......But it felt strange.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、それは不思議な感覚。
Russian (RU): ......Но что‐то было не так.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas algo parece estranho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，這是一種好不可思議的感覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，这是一种好不可思议的感觉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ma era strano.

Steam (ST): Is this golden rose garden a dream?
Umineko Project (UP): Is this golden rose garden a dream?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Is this golden rose garden a dream?
PC Japanese (JP): この黄金の薔薇庭園が、夢なのか。
Russian (RU): Разве этот золотой розарий — сон?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Este jardim de rosas douradas seria um sonho?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個黃金玫瑰庭園，是夢呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个黄金玫瑰庭园，是梦呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo giardino è un sogno?

Steam (ST): For some strange reason, it felt as though my entire life up to this point had been a dream, and that I had finally awakened here...
Umineko Project (UP): For some strange reason, it even felt as though my entire life up to this point had been a dream, and that I had finally awakened here...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 今までの使用人としての生活が夢で、今、ここでこうして目覚めたのか、……その程度のことにさえ混乱してしまう、不思議な感覚…。
Russian (RU): По какой‐то странной причине казалось, что вся моя жизнь до сих пор была сном, и я наконец проснулась здесь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por alguma estranha razão, parece até que toda a minha vida até aqui foi apenas um sonho, e que eu finalmente despertei aqui...

PC Japanese (JP): 「わかろうとしないで良い…。ただ、これだけは信じよ。妾はそなたに危害を加えるために、ここに呼んだのではない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わかろうとしないで良い…。ただ、これだけは信じよ。妾はそなたに危害を加えるために、ここに呼んだのではない」
Russian (RU): "Не нужно понимать... Поверь только в одно. Я позвала тебя сюда не для того, чтобы причинять вред."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você não precisa entender... Mas acredite nisto. Eu não a chamei aqui para fazer mal."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「汝不用嘗試理解…。只用相信這一點。妾身並不是為了對汝施加傷害，才把汝叫來這裡的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「汝不用尝试理解…。只用相信这一点。妾身并不是为了对汝施加伤害，才把汝叫来这里的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non c'è bisogno che tu capisca... ma credimi. Non ti ho portata qui per farti del male."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "I-Isn't this inside one of my dreams...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "I‐isn't this inside one of my dreams...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I, isn't this inside one of my dreams...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「こ、ここは私の夢の中、ではないのですか…？」
Russian (RU): "Ра... разве я не во сне?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "I‐Isto não é o interior dos meus sonhos...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這、這裡，並不是在我的夢中嗎…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这、这里，并不是在我的梦中吗…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Q-Questo non è un mio sogno...?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "You may think of it that way. Strictly speaking, I beckoned your soul to my garden while you were sleeping. To invite you to be a resident of this world."
Umineko Project (UP): "You may think of it that way. Strictly speaking, I beckoned your soul to my garden while you were sleeping. To invite you to be a resident of this world."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「夢の中と思って良い。厳密には、眠ったそなたの魂を、我が庭園に招いたのだ。そなたを、この世界の住人に招くために。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「夢の中と思って良い。厳密には、眠ったそなたの魂を、我が庭園に招いたのだ。そなたを、この世界の住人に招くために」
Russian (RU): "Можно сказать и так. Строго говоря, я заманила твою душу в свой сад, пока ты спала. Чтобы пригласить тебя в этот мир."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você poderia pensar dessa forma. Tecnicamente falando, eu invitei sua alma ao meu jardim enquanto você dormia. Para convidá‐la a ser uma residente deste mundo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「汝就認為是在夢中好了。嚴格地講，妾身是把沉睡中的汝的靈魂，請來了吾的庭園。而此舉是為了，邀汝來當這個世界的住民。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「汝就认为是在梦中好了。严格地讲，妾身是把沉睡中的汝的灵魂，请来了吾的庭园。而此举是为了，邀汝来当这个世界的住民。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Puoi pensarla così. Parlando chiaramente, ho richiamato qui la tua anima mentre dormivi. Per invitarti ad essere un abitante di questo mondo."

Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} snapped her fingers, and a storm of gold butterflies all rose up around the rose garden.
Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} snapped her fingers, and a storm of gold butterflies all rose up around the rose garden.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice snapped her fingers, and a storm of gold butterflies all rose up around the rose garden.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェが指を鳴らすと、黄金の薔薇庭園に、まるでカーテンが包み込むように、黄金の蝶の群が舞い上がった。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче} щёлкнула пальцами, и по розарию закружилась буря золотых бабочек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} estalou seus dedos, e logo uma tempestade de borboletas douradas elevou‐se ao redor do jardim de rosas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切打了個響指，在黃金玫瑰庭園中，恰似蓋過來的帷幕般，涌起了黃金蝶群。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切打了个响指，在黄金玫瑰庭园中，恰似盖过来的帷幕般，涌起了黄金蝶群。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Beatrice schioccò le sue dita, e una tempesta di farfalle dorate si alzò nel giardino di rose.

Steam (ST): As the cloud of butterflies danced over the table, a gorgeous tea set appeared.
Umineko Project (UP): As the cloud of butterflies danced over the table, a gorgeous tea set appeared.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the cloud of butterflies danced over the table, a gorgeous tea set appeared.
PC Japanese (JP): その蝶たちのつむじ風がテーブルの上で踊ると、そこには、豪華なティーパーティの道具が揃う。
Russian (RU): Как только облако золотых бабочек прокружило над столом, появился великолепный чайный сервиз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a nuvem de borboletas dançou sobre a mesa, um maravilhoso jogo de chá apareceu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 蝴蝶旋風在桌上卷了一會兒後，桌上多了一套，擺齊了的豪華的茶會茶具。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 蝴蝶旋风在桌上卷了一会儿后，桌上多了一套，摆齐了的豪华的茶会茶具。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando la nuvola di farfalle danzò sul tavolo, un magnifico servizio da tè apparve.

Steam (ST): There were tea cups and a tea pot, more elegant even than those used by the Ushiromiya family.
Umineko Project (UP): There were tea cups and a tea pot, more elegant even than those used by the Ushiromiya family.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were tea cups and a tea pot, more elegant even than those used by the Ushiromiya family.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家でも扱っていないような上品なティーカップとティーポット。
Russian (RU): Чайные чашки и чайник оказались даже элегантнее тех, что были в семье Уширомия.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Haviam xícaras e bules de chá, mais elegantes do que aqueles utilizados pela família Ushiromiya.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是感覺就連右代宮家都沒有的，典雅的茶杯與茶壺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是感觉就连右代宫家都没有的，典雅的茶杯与茶壶。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): C'erano tazze da tè e una teiera, più elegante anche di quelle usate dalla famiglia Ushiromiya.

Steam (ST): The tea was filled to the brim and had a sweet rose scent, one which Shannon had never smelled before.
Umineko Project (UP): The tea filled the cups to the brim and had a sweet rose scent, one which Shannon had never smelled before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The tea was filled to the brim and had a sweet rose scent, one which Shannon had never smelled before.
PC Japanese (JP): なみなみと注がれた紅茶は、一度も嗅いだことのない、甘い薔薇の香りが漂う。
Russian (RU): Чай был налит до краёв, и от него исходил сладкий аромат роз, который Шаннон никогда раньше не чувствовала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O chá preencheu as xícaras até a borda e exalou um doce aroma de rosas, o qual Shannon nunca tinha sentido antes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 滿滿斟了一杯的紅茶，飄著從未聞過的玫瑰芳香。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 满满斟了一杯的红茶，飘着从未闻过的玫瑰芳香。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il tè aveva un dolce odore di rosa, che Shannon non aveva mai sentito prima.

Steam (ST): Before there was even time to be amazed by that scent, butterflies started gathering one by one on the table, and a tea stand sprouted right out of it.
Umineko Project (UP): Before there was even time to be amazed by that scent, butterflies started gathering one by one on the table, and a tea stand sprouted right out of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Before there was even time to be amazed by that scent, butterflies started gathering one by one on the table, and a tea stand sprouted right out of it.
PC Japanese (JP): その香りに呆然とする間もなく、テーブルの上には、次々に黄金蝶たちが集い、そこにはにょっきりとティースタンドが生えだすのだ。
Russian (RU): Прежде чем настало время поразиться этому аромату, бабочки собрались над столом, и прямо из него проросла чайная подставка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes mesmo de ter tempo para ficar maravilhada pelo aroma, borboletas começaram a se reunir, uma por uma, sobre a mesa e uma {i:étagère} brotou dali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛為那香味愣住沒多久，在桌上，就又漸漸聚集起了黃金蝶，在那長出了一座茶架。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚为那香味愣住没多久，在桌上，就又渐渐聚集起了黄金蝶，在那长出了一座茶架。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Prima ancora che rimanesse stupita da quell'odore, le farfalle iniziarono a radunarsi una ad una sul tavolo, e spuntò subito un magnifico porta-tè.

Steam (ST): It was like watching a magical mushroom from a fairy tale kingdom grow out of the ground.
Umineko Project (UP): It was like watching a magical mushroom from a fairy tale kingdom grow out of the ground.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was like watching a magical mushroom from a fairy tale kingdom grow out of the ground.
PC Japanese (JP): それはまるで、おとぎの国で、魔法のキノコが生え出すかのように、にょっきりと。
Russian (RU): Словно из‐под земли вырос волшебный гриб из сказочного царства.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi como assistir cogumelos mágicos crescendo no solo de um reino de conto de fadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 簡直就像是童話王國的魔法蘑菇破土而出般地，從那長了出來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 简直就像是童话王国的魔法蘑菇破土而出般地，从那长了出来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era come guardare un fungo magico di un regno favoloso spuntare dal terreno.

Steam (ST): It was a many-layered tea stand, filled with beautiful cakes, like edible jewels.
Umineko Project (UP): The many‐layered tea stand was filled with beautiful cakes that were deserving of being called edible jewels.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a many-layered tea stand, filled with beautiful cakes, like edible jewels.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてティースタンドの各段には、食べる宝飾品と例えるのが相応しい、見目麗しいケーキが並ぶ。
Russian (RU): Многоуровневая чайная подставка была наполнена чудесными пирожными, напоминающими съедобные драгоценности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A {i:étagère} de vários andares estava recheada de lindos bolos que mereciam ser chamados de joias comestíveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在茶架的每一層上都排列著，比喻為“能吃的珠寶飾品”才恰當的，外觀精美的蛋糕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在茶架的每一层上都排列着，比喻为“能吃的珠宝饰品”才恰当的，外观精美的蛋糕。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era un porta-tè con molti ripiani, pieno di splendide torte, come gioielli commestibili.

Steam (ST): Of course, there were also several lovely, light-brown scones. The honey truly was golden honey, with bits of gold leaf dancing through it...
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, there were also several lovely, light‐brown scones. The honey truly was golden honey, with bits of gold leaf dancing through it......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, there were also several lovely, light-brown scones. The honey truly was golden honey, with bits of gold leaf dancing through it......
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、美しいキツネ色に焼き上げられたスコーンもある。添えられたハチミツは、金箔が躍る、まさに黄金のハチミツだった……。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, также было несколько восхитительных, светло‐коричневых булочек. Мёд был самый что ни на есть золотой, и в нём плавали кусочки золотых листьев......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, também haviam diversos {i:scones} adoráveis de coloração ocre. O mel era verdadeiramente um mel dourado, com pequenos pedaços de folha de ouro dançando sobre ele......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，那裡還放著被烤成好看的棕褐色的英式烤餅。塗在上面的蜂蜜金箔閃爍，簡直就正是那黃金的蜂蜜……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，那里还放着被烤成好看的棕褐色的英式烤饼。涂在上面的蜂蜜金箔闪烁，简直就正是那黄金的蜂蜜……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, c'erano anche molti, splendidi pasticcini. Il miele era davvero miele dorato, con pizzichi di foglie d'oro che vi danzavano dentro...

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "It seems the Ushiromiya family holds tea parties from time to time, but those cannot compare to mine."
Umineko Project (UP): "It seems the Ushiromiya family holds tea parties from time to time, but those cannot compare to mine."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「右代宮家も時にティーパーティを開くようだが、妾のそれとは比べ物にもなるまい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「右代宮家も時にティーパーティを開くようだが、妾のそれとは比べ物にもなるまい」
Russian (RU): "В семье Уширомия порой устраивают чаепития, но их не сравнить с моими."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Parece que a família Ushiromiya faz festas do chá de tempos em tempo, mas elas não se comparam com a minha."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「虽说右代宫家有时也召开茶会，但那个可与妾身的茶会没得比哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sembra che la famiglia Ushiromiya tenga dei tea party di tanto in tanto, ma non possono essere paragonati al mio."

Steam (ST): "...I-Incredible... I've never seen anything like this..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I‐.........incredible...... ...I've never seen anything like this..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I, ...incredible... I've never seen anything like this..."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……す、………すごい……。…こんなの、見たことありません……」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......I‐.........Inacreditável...... ...Eu nunca vi nada assim antes..."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "*cackle*cackle* Even if you did, it would only have been as a waitress. You are my friend. I need no waitress. After all, I am a witch. That is more than enough. Come, do not be shy. Stuff yourself to your heart's content."
Umineko Project (UP): "*cackle*cackle*. Even if you had, it would only have been as a waitress. You are my friend. I need no waitress. After all, I am a witch. That is more than enough. Come, do not be shy. Stuff yourself to your heart's content."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "*cackle*cackle*. Even if you did, it would only have been as a waitress. You are my friend. I need no waitress. After all, I am a witch. That is more than enough. Come, do not be shy. Stuff yourself to your heart's content."
PC Japanese (JP): 「くっくっくっく。見たことがあろうとも、それは給仕をする立場からであろうが。そなたは妾の友人。給仕の必要はないぞ。何しろ、妾は魔女。給仕は間に合っているのでな。さぁ、遠慮することはない。好きなだけ頬張るが良い。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「くっくっくっく。見たことがあろうとも、それは給仕をする立場からであろうが。そなたは妾の友人。給仕の必要はないぞ。何しろ、妾は魔女。給仕は間に合っているのでな。さぁ、遠慮することはない。好きなだけ頬張るが良い」
Russian (RU): "*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*. Даже если и видела, то только когда была официанткой. Ты моя подруга. Мне не нужна официантка. Я же ведьма. Этого более чем достаточно. Ну же, не стесняйся. Бери что пожелаешь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "*gargalhada*gargalhada*. Mesmo que tivesse visto, seria como garçonete. Você é minha amiga. Eu não preciso de garçonete. Até porque eu sou uma bruxa. Já é mais do que suficiente. Vamos, não seja tímida. Pode estufar suas bochechas com o que mais gostar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呵呵呵呵。哪怕見過，汝也是站在倒茶添點心的立場上見的吧。汝是妾身的朋友。不用汝來倒茶添點心。畢竟，妾身是魔女。茶水點心不會斷檔。來，休要客氣。盡情地把美食塞滿汝的嘴巴吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呵呵呵呵。哪怕见过，汝也是站在倒茶添点心的立场上见的吧。汝是妾身的朋友。不用汝来倒茶添点心。毕竟，妾身是魔女。茶水点心不会断档。来，休要客气。尽情地把美食塞满汝的嘴巴吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "*cackle*cackle*. Anche se tu vi avessi partecipato, sarebbe stato solo come domestica. Tu sei mia amica. Non ho bisogno di domestici. Dopotutto, sono una strega. È più che sufficiente. Avanti, non essere timida. Prendi tutto quello che vuoi."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Th... ...Thank you... very much..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Th‐......thank you...very much......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Th, ......thank you... very much......"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "G... Grazie... davvero..."

Steam (ST): That was all Shannon managed to say. ...It would be hard for anyone to say much more after being suddenly invited to such a beautiful witch tea party.
Umineko Project (UP): That was all Shannon could manage to say. .........It would be hard for anyone to say much more after being suddenly invited to such a beautiful witch tea party.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was all Shannon managed to say. ......It would be hard for anyone to say much more after being suddenly invited to such a beautiful witch tea party.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音はそう言うのが精一杯だった。………このあまりに美しい魔女のお茶会に唐突に招かれたなら、誰だってそれを言うのが精一杯だろう。
Russian (RU): Это всё, что Шаннон смогла выговорить. ......Было бы трудно сказать нечто большее после неожиданного приглашения на такое удивительное ведьмино чаепитие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso foi tudo que Shannon conseguiu dizer. .........Seria difícil para qualquer um dizer mais do que isso após ser invitado tão de repente para uma festa do chá tão bela..

Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音光是讲出这话，就已极尽了全力。………突然被邀至这种过于华美的魔女的茶会，无论谁都一样，都会光是讲出这话就得拼尽全力的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo fu tutto ciò che Shannon riuscì a dire. ... Sarebbe difficile per chiunque dire altro dopo essere stati improvvisamente invitati ad un magnifico tea party stregato.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Let us begin with black tea. The milk is fresh, and the sugar is so delectable that you'd almost want to eat it raw. But I recommend you try your tea straight first. With nothing more than a single rose petal floating on the top, it will surely be so delicious that you'll be unable to drink the black tea of the human world ever again...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Let us begin with black tea. The milk is fresh, and the sugar is so delectable that you'd almost want to eat it raw. But I recommend you try your tea straight first. With nothing more than a single rose petal floating on the top, it will surely be so delicious that you'll be unable to drink the black tea of the human world ever again...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「まずは紅茶からどうか。ミルクは新鮮、砂糖もそのままかじりたくなるほどの上物よ。しかし、まずは最初はストレートを勧めたい。薔薇の花びらをほんの１枚浮かべるだけで、もう二度と人の世の紅茶など飲めなくなってしまうに違いないぞ…！」
Russian (RU): "Начнём с чёрного чая. Свежее молоко и такой восхитительный сахар, что его чуть ли не хочется съесть прямо так. Но я рекомендую тебе сначала попробовать чай. С плавающим сверху лепестком розы — одним и не более — он непременно окажется таким вкусным, что ты больше никогда не сможешь пить чёрный чай мира людей!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos começar com o chá preto. O leite é fresco, já o açúcar é tão deleitável que dá vontade de comer puro. Mas recomendo experimentar seu chá sem nada primeiro. Com nada mais do que uma única pétala de rosa flutuando em cima, ele certamente será tão delicioso que você nunca mais será capaz de beber o chá do mundo humano novamente...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「首先，從品品紅茶開始如何？牛奶很新鮮，糖也是看著就想咬一口的上等佳品喲。不過，妾身建議，汝先嘗一下純紅茶。僅憑放上一片玫瑰花瓣，飄浮於茶面，它就無疑能令人再也不想去喝什麼人世的紅茶了…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「首先，从品品红茶开始如何？牛奶很新鲜，糖也是看着就想咬一口的上等佳品哟。不过，妾身建议，汝先尝一下纯红茶。仅凭放上一片玫瑰花瓣，飘浮于茶面，它就无疑能令人再也不想去喝什么人世的红茶了…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Iniziamo col tè nero. Il latte è fresco, e lo zucchero è così buono che verrebbe da mangiarlo così com'è. Ma ti consiglio di provare prima il tè così com'è. {n}Con nient'altro che un singolo petalo di rosa, sarà di certo così delizioso che non vorrai mai più bere il tè nero del mondo umano...!"

Steam (ST): Laughing happily, {f:5:Beatrice} opened, not a sugar pot, but a rose petal pot, picked up a single crimson petal, and floated it on her tea after relishing its scent.
Umineko Project (UP): Laughing happily, {f:5:Beatrice} opened, not a sugar pot, but a rose petal pot, picked up a single crimson petal, and floated it on her tea after relishing its scent.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "I am glad you enjoy it. I bred this rose simply for the purpose of using the petals with black tea. If you crush them, they're also splendid for making jam! That goes better with scones than anything else imaginable. Do you want to try?"
Umineko Project (UP): "I am glad you enjoy it. I bred this rose simply for the purpose of using the petals with black tea. If you crush them, they're also splendid for making jam! That goes better with scones than anything else imaginable. Do you want to try?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「喜んでもらえて嬉しい。妾が紅茶に浮かべるためだけに品種改良を重ねた薔薇だ。すり潰してジャムにしても、これがまた絶品でな！　スコーンにもこの上なくよく合う。試してみるか？」
Russian (RU): "Рада, что тебе нравится. Я выращиваю эту розу чисто ради лепестков для чёрного чая. Если их измельчить, они прекрасно подойдут и для варенья! К булочкам оно подходит лучше всего, что только можно себе представить. Хочешь попробовать?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Fico feliz que tenha gostado. Eu criei estas rosas pelo simples propósito de usar suas pétalas no chá preto. Se esmagá‐las, elas fornecerão a você uma maravilhosa geleia! Combina melhor com {i:scones} do que qualquer outra coisa que possa imaginar. Gostaria de experimentar?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「很高興汝能喜歡。此乃妾身為了“配于紅茶，漂於茶面”而進行過多次品種改良的玫瑰。研磨成醬也是絕品！配上英式烤餅，也無與倫比地非常合適。要不要來試試？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「很高兴汝能喜欢。此乃妾身为了“配于红茶，漂于茶面”而进行过多次品种改良的玫瑰。研磨成酱也是绝品！配上英式烤饼，也无与伦比地非常合适。要不要来试试？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sono felice che ti piaccia. Ho coltivato queste rose con il solo scopo di usarne i petali con il tè nero. Se le schiacci, sono ottime anche per farci marmellata! {n}Va meglio con i pasticcini e tutto quello che puoi immaginare. Vuoi provare?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}

Umineko Project (UP): "Servant work really is tiring. I remember it well. Particularly cleaning the windowsills in the chapel."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「使用人の仕事も大変であろうな。妾もよく覚えているぞ。礼拝堂の窓枠の掃除が、とにかく面倒であった」

Umineko Project (UP): "How surprising. So, you worked as a servant once too?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}

Umineko Project (UP): "For a short time. You probably don't remember, but I worked alongside you. I was a clumsy fool who always lost things. You were my idea of a perfect servant and the person I looked up to."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「短い間だ。覚えておらぬだろうが、そなたとともに働いていたのだぞ。妾はドジで物をよくなくす愚か者。そなたは妾の憧れる、理想の使用人であった」
Russian (RU): "Недолго. Ты вряд ли помнишь, но мы работали вместе. Я была неуклюжей, вечно всё теряющей дурой, а ты была моим представлением об идеальной слуге и той, на кого я хотела походить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Por um curto tempo. Você provavelmente não se lembra, mas eu trabalhei ao seu lado. Como serviçal, eu sempre perdia as coisas e fazia bobagem. Você era o meu ideal de serviçal perfeito e também a pessoa que eu almejava ser."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「幹得不久。雖然汝是不記得了吧，但妾身可曾跟汝一起工作過哦。妾身是個呆頭呆腦老丟東西的蠢貨。而汝是妾身所憧憬的，理想的傭人。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「干得不久。虽然汝是不记得了吧，但妾身可曾跟汝一起工作过哦。妾身是个呆头呆脑老丢东西的蠢货。而汝是妾身所憧憬的，理想的佣人。」

Steam (ST): "There is no need for apologies. Here, you are not a servant, but my friend and guest. There are no inconveniences here, no trials nor boredom. I can give you anything you desire. That is how much power I currently possess. ...I wanted to let you know that I have now reached that level."
Umineko Project (UP): "There is no need for apologies. Here, you are not a servant, but my friend and guest. There are no inconveniences here, no trials nor boredom. I can give you anything you desire. That is how much power I currently possess. ......I wanted to let you know that I have now reached that level."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「それを詫びる必要はない。ここではそなたは使用人ではなく、妾の友人であり客人だ。ここでは何の不自由もない、何の苦労も退屈もない。そなたが望む全てのものを与えることが出来るのだ。今や妾にはそれだけの力がある。……それに至ったことを、そなたには知らせたかったのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それを詫びる必要はない。ここではそなたは使用人ではなく、妾の友人であり客人だ。ここでは何の不自由もない、何の苦労も退屈もない。そなたが望む全てのものを与えることが出来るのだ。今や妾にはそれだけの力がある。……それに至ったことを、そなたには知らせたかったのだ」
Russian (RU): "Не нужно извиняться. Здесь ты не слуга, а моя подруга и гостья. Никаких неудобств, испытаний и скуки. Я могу дать тебе всё что пожелаешь. Вот какой силой я сейчас обладаю. ......Я хотела, чтобы ты узнала, каких высот я достигла."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não precisa se desculpar por nada. Aqui, você não é uma serviçal, mas minha amiga e minha convidada. Não há inconveniências aqui, sem provas ou tédio. Eu posso dar a você tudo o que desejar. Agora, eu possuo poder o suficiente para isso. ......Eu quero que saiba que agora eu cheguei a um novo nível."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不必為此道歉。在這裡，汝不是傭人，而是妾身的朋友兼客人。在這，不會有任何不便，不用吃任何苦，不會感到悶。能夠給汝，汝想要的一切。現今，妾身有這麼大的能力。……妾身是想告訴汝，妾身抵達了這個境界哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不必为此道歉。在这里，汝不是佣人，而是妾身的朋友兼客人。在这，不会有任何不便，不用吃任何苦，不会感到闷。能够给汝，汝想要的一切。现今，妾身有这么大的能力。……妾身是想告诉汝，妾身抵达了这个境界哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non c'è bisogno di scuse. Qui, non sei una domestica, ma mia amica e ospite. Non ci sono inconvenienti qui, né problemi né noia. Posso darti tutto ciò che desideri. Questo è il potere che possiedo ora. ... Volevo farti sapere che ho raggiunto questo livello."

Russian (RU): "Ну же, золотые бабочки! Не дайте моей подруге заскучать! Покажите ей танец! Если тебе надоест, позволь мне позвать группу, которая исполнит для тебя любую песню. Когда устанешь от этого, мои утончённые знакомые покажут тебе фокусы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Venham, borboletas de ouro! Não deixem minha amiga ficar entediada! Mostrem a ela uma pequena dança! Quando se cansar dela, permita‐me chamar a banda e mandá‐la tocar qualquer música que desejar. Se ficar cansada disso também, os meus refinados familiares mostrarão a você alguns truques de mágica."

Quando ti sarai annoiata di ciò, permettimi di chiamare la banda per sentire tutte le canzoni che vuoi. Quando te ne sarai annoiata, i miei famigli ti mostreranno i loro trucchi di magia.

PC Japanese (JP): 安心せよ、ここでの時間は無限。そしてそなたの願いもまた、妾が無限に叶える。妾の茶会に終わりはないのだ…！」

Umineko Project (UP): In a truly good mood, the witch told Shannon several strange stories.

Steam (ST): They were all stories Shannon had never heard before. Very interesting stories. And, they were all odd, bizarre fairy tales.
Umineko Project (UP): They were all stories Shannon had never heard before. Very interesting stories. And they were all odd, bizarre fairy tales.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were all stories Shannon had never heard before. Very interesting stories. And, they were all odd, bizarre fairy tales.

Steam (ST): Shannon felt as though she had become Alice in Wonderland. The time she spent at this tea party was strange, pleasant, and relaxed.

PC Japanese (JP): まるで自分が、不思議の国のアリスにでもなってしまったかのような。そんな不思議な不思議な、愉快な愉快な、ゆっくりとしたお茶会の時間。

Steam (ST): So, the time passed like a Sunday morning, when you can wrap yourself in your blanket for as long as you want...
Umineko Project (UP): So, the time passed like a Sunday morning, when you can wrap yourself in your blanket for as long as you want......

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Que tipo coisa que eu desconheço, a Shannon pode conhecer?! Como esta "coisa" pode ser encontrada no mundo {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano}, mas não no meu paraíso?! Eu não entendo! .........Eu quero saber!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………妾身不知道，紗音知道的愉悅究竟是什麼！！在妾身的理想鄉中沒有，只在人類的世界裡有的某物，究竟是什麼？！搞不懂！………好想知道！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………妾身不知道，纱音知道的愉悦究竟是什么！！在妾身的理想乡中没有，只在人类的世界里有的某物，究竟是什么？！搞不懂！………好想知道！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Quale piacere può conoscere che io non ho?! Cos'è questo ‘qualcosa’ che può essere trovato nel mondo umano ma non nel mio Paradiso?! Non capisco! ... Voglio sapere!"

Steam (ST): "Thinking about complicated stuff will just fuel your headache. I can be of service in Shannon's place. Let's enjoy a tea party together."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「難しいこと考えたって、頭痛の種に水をやるだけだわ。紗音の代わりなら、私が務めてあげる。私たちで楽しくお茶会を過ごしましょうよ」

Speaker: Ushiromiya George

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……大人たちにとっては緊張感を強いられる日だったろうけれど。僕たち子供にとっては、仲良しのいとこたちと一度に会える素敵な日だったね」
Russian (RU): "......Для взрослых этот день полон напряжённости, но для детей это удивительный, единственный день встречи с любимыми кузенами."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "In the summer, we'd play with our cousins on the beach, and even in the winter, there were plenty of games we could play! The family conferences were tons of fun for us."
Umineko Project (UP): "In the summer, we could play with our cousins on the beach, and there were plenty of games we could play in the winter! The family conferences were tons of fun for us."

PC Japanese (JP): 「夏はいとこたちで海ではしゃいだし、冬は冬で、色々ゲームをして遊んだっけ！俺たちにとっては、親族会議ってのは楽しいもんだったぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「夏はいとこたちで海ではしゃいだし、冬は冬で、色々ゲームをして遊んだっけ！　俺たちにとっては、親族会議ってのは楽しいもんだったぜ」
Russian (RU): "Летом мы с кузенами могли играть на пляже, да и зимой находили много игр! Для нас семейные собрания были очень весёлыми."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "No verão, nós podíamos brincar com nossos primos na praia e também tinha muitos jogos que podíamos brincar no inverno! A conferência familiar tinha muita diversão para nós."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「夏天就堂兄妹們一起在海邊玩鬧，冬天麼，就玩玩各種各樣的遊戲！對我們來說，所謂的親族會議，可開心了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「夏天就堂兄妹们一起在海边玩闹，冬天么，就玩玩各种各样的游戏！对我们来说，所谓的亲族会议，可开心了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In estate, potevamo giocare con i nostri cugini sulla spiaggia, e c'erano tanti giochi che potevamo fare anche in inverno! Le riunioni di famiglia erano divertentissime per noi."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Steam (ST): "Same here. Mom was always yelling about how there must be no mistakes, but to me, it was just the day I got to play with all my cousins. After all, there's usually nothing at all to do on Rokkenjima."
Umineko Project (UP): "Same here. Mom was always yelling about how there must be no mistakes, but to me, it was just the day I got to play with all my cousins. After all, there's usually nothing at all to do on Rokkenjima."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「それは私もだぜ。母さんなんかは、粗相があってはダメとかうるさかったけど。私にとっても、いとこみんなで遊べる楽しい日だった。何しろ、普段の六軒島には、何もねぇんだから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それは私もだぜ。母さんなんかは、粗相があってはダメとかうるさかったけど。私にとっても、いとこみんなで遊べる楽しい日だった。何しろ、普段の六軒島には、何もねぇんだから」
Russian (RU): "Согласна. Мама всегда кричала, что не должно быть допущено ни единой ошибки, но для меня это был всего лишь день, когда я могла играть со всеми своими кузенами. Ведь обычно на Роккенджиме совсем нечем заняться."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Concordo. Minha mãe sempre ficava gritando sobre como tudo precisava estar perfeito, mas para mim, era apenas um dia onde eu podia brincar com todos os meus primos. Afinal, normalmente não tinha nada para se fazer em Rokkenjima."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這個我也一樣嘞。儘管媽媽在煩我，讓我不可疏於禮數。但對我來說，這天也同樣是個能和堂兄妹們開心玩耍的日子。畢竟，平時的六軒島，什麼都沒有。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这个我也一样嘞。尽管妈妈在烦我，让我不可疏于礼数。但对我来说，这天也同样是个能和堂兄妹们开心玩耍的日子。毕竟，平时的六轩岛，什么都没有。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Lo stesso per me. Mamma continuava a gridare che non dovevano esserci errori, ma per me, era solo il giorno in cui avrei potuto giocare con tutti i miei cugini. Dopotutto, in genere non c'è nulla da fare su Rokkenjima."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Back when I was still a little brat, I was always jealous of Jessica, getting to live in this huge mansion with a private beach. But now that I try putting myself in her shoes, it must've been a pretty constricting place to live."
Umineko Project (UP): "Jessica got to live in this huge mansion with a private beach. I was always jealous of her when I was a brat. But thinking about it from her perspective, it must've been a pretty constricting place to live."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Back when I was still a little brat, I was always jealous of Jessica, getting to live in this huge mansion with a private beach. But now that I try putting myself in her shoes, it must've been a pretty constricting place to live."
PC Japanese (JP): 「すげぇお屋敷に住んでたり、プライベートビーチがあったり。ガキの頃は羨ましいと思ってたけど。朱志香の身になって考えると、さぞや窮屈だったと思うぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「すげぇお屋敷に住んでたり、プライベートビーチがあったり。ガキの頃は羨ましいと思ってたけど。朱志香の身になって考えると、さぞや窮屈だったと思うぜ」
Russian (RU): "Ещё будучи мальчишкой, я всегда завидовал Джессике, живущей в огромном особняке с частным пляжем. Но если поставить себя на её место, для неё это наверняка узкий уголок для жизни."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A Jessica se acostumou a viver em uma grande mansão com uma praia privativa. Eu sempre tive inveja dela quando eu era menor. Mas, pensando pela perspectiva que ela colocou agora, deveria ser um lugar muito restritivo para se viver."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「住在好氣派的大屋裡，擁有私家海灘。雖然在我還是小鬼的時候覺得很羨慕。但從朱志香的角度設身處地地想一下，就覺得這想必肯定缺乏自由了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「住在好气派的大屋里，拥有私家海滩。虽然在我还是小鬼的时候觉得很羡慕。但从朱志香的角度设身处地地想一下，就觉得这想必肯定缺乏自由了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quando ero ancora un moccioso, ero sempre geloso di Jessica, che viveva in questa enorme villa con spiaggia privata. Ma ora che provo a mettermi nei suoi panni, deve essere stato un posto davvero noioso in cui vivere."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "Probably... There's hardly anything on Rokkenjima. No friends' houses, no next door neighbors, no neighborhood. If you think of how Jessica must have felt, you have to feel a little sad for her."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes, probably...... There's hardly anything on Rokkenjima. No friends' houses, no next door neighbors, no neighborhood. When I consider Jessica‐chan's feelings about that, I feel a little sad for her."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Probably...... There's hardly anything on Rokkenjima. No friends' houses, no next door neighbors, no neighborhood. If you think of how Jessica must have felt, you have to feel a little sad for her."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu gosto de discutir e imaginar todo tipo de coisa. Se tratando de livros de mistérios, a leitura é só metade da diversão. A minha teoria é sobre como você aproveita de verdade um livro de mistério quando conversa sobre ele com outra pessoa que já leu."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「時而進行討論，時而展開妄想，倒是挺開心的呢。讀完推理小說，只是享受了一半的樂趣，讀完同一部小說的人一起討論，才能首次享受到全部的樂趣，這可是我的一貫見解哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「时而进行讨论，时而展开妄想，倒是挺开心的呢。读完推理小说，只是享受了一半的乐趣，读完同一部小说的人一起讨论，才能首次享受到全部的乐趣，这可是我的一贯见解哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Mi piace discuterne e immaginare tante cose. Nei gialli, leggere è solo metà del divertimento. La mia teoria è che puoi goderteli davvero quando parli con altre persone che li hanno letti."

Steam (ST): Our relationship began when we realized that we both read mystery novels.
Umineko Project (UP): It all started when we realized that we both read mystery novels.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Our relationship began when we realized that we both read mystery novels.
PC Japanese (JP): 二人の交流は、同じ推理小説を読んでいたことを知った時から始まった。
Russian (RU): Наши отношения начались когда мы поняли, что оба читаем детективы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo começou quando eu percebi que ambos líamos romances policiais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這兩人的交流，是從得知彼此在讀同一本推理小說時開始的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这两人的交流，是从得知彼此在读同一本推理小说时开始的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La nostra relazione iniziò quando entrambi ci accorgemmo che amavamo i gialli.

Steam (ST): We were both surprised and very interested to find that the other not only read tons of mystery novels, but read them very thoroughly.
Umineko Project (UP): We were both surprised and very interested to find that the other not only read tons of mystery novels, but read them very thoroughly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We were both surprised and very interested to find that the other not only read tons of mystery novels, but read them very thoroughly.
PC Japanese (JP): 互いにとって、相手が自分と同じくらい深く、そしてたくさんの推理小説を読んでいたことは大いに意外で、相互の関心を引いた。
Russian (RU): Мы вдвоём очень удивились и с интересом обнаружили, что другой читает тонны детективов, причём очень внимательно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós dois ficamos muito surpresos e interessados em descobrir que o outro não era apenas um ávido leitor de mistérios, mas que também os lia minuciosamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們彼此之間都很意外，對方跟自己一樣，推理小說讀得又深又多，從而勾起了對彼此的興趣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们彼此之间都很意外，对方跟自己一样，推理小说读得又深又多，从而勾起了对彼此的兴趣。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eravamo entrambi sorpresi e molto interessati a scoprire che non solo ne leggevamo tantissimi, ma li leggevamo con grande attenzione.

Steam (ST): Ever since then, it's been like this.
Umineko Project (UP): Ever since then, it's been like this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ever since then, it's been like this.
PC Japanese (JP): それ以来、こうして。
Russian (RU): С тех пор всё было так.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Desde então, tem sido assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自那以來，就像這樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自那以来，就像这样。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sin da allora, è stato così.

Steam (ST): Separate from the games we played with all the cousins, the two of us met together for some time alone...
Umineko Project (UP): Separate from the games we played with all the cousins, the two of us met together for some time alone......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Separate from the games we played with all the cousins, the two of us met together for some time alone......
PC Japanese (JP): いとこたち４人でのはしゃぎ合いはと別に、二人きりの特別な時間を持ち合っている……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いとこたち４人でのはしゃぎ合いとは別に、二人きりの特別な時間を持ち合っている……。
Russian (RU): Отдельно от игр, в которые мы играли со всеми кузенами, некоторое время мы проводили вдвоём......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): À parte das brincadeiras que reuniam todos os primos, nós dois nos encontrávamos para passar um tempo sozinhos......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與堂兄妹 4 人一起的歡鬧不相重合，他們彼此都抽出了，兩人獨處的特別的時間……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与堂兄妹 4 人一起的欢闹不相重合，他们彼此都抽出了，两人独处的特别的时间……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Separati dai giochi che facevamo con tutti i cugini, noi due ci incontravamo da soli per un po' di tempo...

Steam (ST): At first, it was like a sort of contest to see who knew more than the other.
Umineko Project (UP): At first, it was like a sort of contest to see who knew more than the other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At first, it was like a sort of contest to see who knew more than the other.
PC Japanese (JP): 始めの内こそ、互いの知識の探り合いのような、ちょっと鍔迫り合いみたいな議論だった。
Russian (RU): Сначала это было нечто вроде соревнования по выяснению того, кто больше знает.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No começo, foi como uma disputa para ver quem sabia mais do que o outro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在最開始時，他們的討論就像是在試探彼此的知識般，稍有點刀劍對拼互不相讓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在最开始时，他们的讨论就像是在试探彼此的知识般，稍有点刀剑对拼互不相让。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): All'inizio, era una specie di gara per vedere chi ne sapeva di più.

Steam (ST): However, eventually, this turned into respect for how much the other had read and how deeply they were able to think about it.
Umineko Project (UP): However, eventually, this turned into respect for how much the other had read and how deeply they were able to think about it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, eventually, this turned into respect for how much the other had read and how deeply they were able to think about it.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれはやがて、互いの読書量や考察の深さを尊敬し合うものへと変わった。
Russian (RU): Но в конце концов мы стали уважать то, сколько читал другой и как глубоко тот мог задуматься о прочитанном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, eventualmente, se transformou em respeito pelo quanto o outro já tinha lido e o quão profundamente era capaz de pensar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這在不久之後就轉變成了，互相尊敬對方的讀書量與考察之深。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这在不久之后就转变成了，互相尊敬对方的读书量与考察之深。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, in seguito, questo si trasformò in rispetto per quanto l'altro avesse letto e quanto a fondo riuscisse a comprenderlo.

Steam (ST): Respect. Trust. Those emotions made our friendship even stronger.
Umineko Project (UP): Respect. Trust.{n}Those emotions made our friendship even stronger.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Respect. Trust. Those emotions made our friendship even stronger.
PC Japanese (JP): 尊敬。信頼。そんな気持ちが互いの友情をさらに育み。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 尊敬。信頼。{n}そんな気持ちが互いの友情をさらに育み。
Russian (RU): Уважение. Доверие.{n}Эти эмоции только укрепили нашу дружбу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Respeito. Confiança.{n}Essas emoções fortaleceram ainda mais a nossa amizade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 尊敬。信任。{n}這種情感，更進一步地培養了彼此的友情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尊敬。信任。{n}这种情感，更进一步地培养了彼此的友情。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Rispetto. Fiducia. Queste emozioni rendevano la nostra amicizia ancora più forte.

Steam (ST): Of course, all of that had still fallen within the category of "friendship"...
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, all of that had still fallen within the category of "friendship"......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, all of that had still fallen within the category of 'friendship'......
PC Japanese (JP): もちろんそれは、友情と呼ぶべき範疇の中に収まってはいたわけだけど……。
Russian (RU): Естественно, все они по‐прежнему попадали в категорию 'дружба'......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, tudo isso ainda caía dentro da categoria "amizade"......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 儘管這當然是包括在，叫做友情的範疇之內的……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尽管这当然是包括在，叫做友情的范畴之内的……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, tutto ciò era raccolto ancora nella categoria ‘amicizia’...

Steam (ST): ...But we were still slightly aware of the fact that the other was of the opposite sex, making for a relationship that was charming, or youthful, ...or maybe you could call it exciting.
Umineko Project (UP): ......But we were still slightly aware of the fact that the other was of the opposite sex, making for a relationship that was charming, or youthful, .........or maybe you could call it exciting.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But we were still slightly aware of the fact that the other was of the opposite sex, making for a relationship that was charming, or youthful, ......or maybe you could call it exciting.
PC Japanese (JP): ……互いが男女であることをほんのりと意識し合う、そんな、微笑ましいというか、若々しいというか、………くすぐったい関係だった。
Russian (RU): ......Но мы всё же осознавали, что другой был противоположного пола, и создавали очаровательные, юные...... или, может, волнующие отношения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas nós ainda estávamos levemente cientes do fato que éramos do sexo oposto, direcionando‐se para uma relação charmosa e jovial, .........ou talvez pudesse ser chamada de empolgante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但這是一種，微微意識到彼此互為異性，令人欣慰的，充滿年輕朝氣的，………心癢難耐的關係。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但这是一种，微微意识到彼此互为异性，令人欣慰的，充满年轻朝气的，………心痒难耐的关系。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Tuttavia eravamo consci del fatto che ognuno era di sesso opposto all'altro, rendendola una relazione affascinante, o giovanile... o forse si potrebbe definire emozionante.

Steam (ST): However, we were still at the age where calling us "young men and women" would probably be a bit too gracious.
Umineko Project (UP): However, we were still so young that even the word "youth" felt like it might be overstating our age.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, we were still at the age where the word 'little' would not be an exaggeration.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし二人はまだ、若いという言葉さえ、まだ過分ではないかと思うほどに、若い。
Russian (RU): Однако мы до сих пор были в том возрасте, когда слово 'маленький' не преувеличение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, nós ainda éramos muito novos até mesmo para a palavra "juventude" parecer estar exagerando nossas idades.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這兩人年輕到了，連“年輕”這個詞都讓人感到，會不會有點為時過早。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这两人年轻到了，连“年轻”这个词都让人感到，会不会有点为时过早。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Comunque, eravamo ancora in quell'età in cui la parola ‘piccoli’ non sarebbe un'esagerazione.

Steam (ST): Of course, we didn't know a thing about love.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, we didn't know a thing about love.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, we didn't know a thing about love.
PC Japanese (JP): 恋など無論、まだ知らない。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, мы ничего не знали о любви.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, nós não sabíamos nada sobre o amor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 愛情什麼的，當然也尚且不懂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爱情什么的，当然也尚且不懂。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ovviamente, non sapevamo nulla dell'amore.

Steam (ST): So, we couldn't understand that exciting feeling in our chests, both bitter and sweet, that we only felt when we were alone together.
Umineko Project (UP): So, we couldn't understand that tickling feeling in our chests, both bitter and sweet, that we only felt when we were alone together.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, we couldn't understand that exciting feeling in our chests, both bitter and sweet, that we only felt when we were alone together.
PC Japanese (JP): だから二人きりでいる時間だけに感じる、この胸の中の、甘いような酸っぱいような、くすぐったい感触が何なのか、理解は出来ない。
Russian (RU): И поэтому не понимали то волнующее, горько‐сладкое чувство в груди, которое испытывали только наедине.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, não conseguíamos entender aquela formigante sensação em nossos peitos, uma sensação agridoce que só sentíamos quando estávamos sozinhos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以他們搞不懂，只會在兩人獨處的時間裡感到的，胸中又酸又甜的癢癢的感覺，究竟是什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以他们搞不懂，只会在两人独处的时间里感到的，胸中又酸又甜的痒痒的感觉，究竟是什么。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi, non potevano comprendere quel senso di eccitazione nei nostri cuori, sia dolce che amaro, che sentivamo solo quando eravamo solo noi due.

Steam (ST): However, we realized that there was some unknown emotion hidden behind that feeling, ...and as our hearts raced, we had our hands upon the door. That was the exciting age we were at.
Umineko Project (UP): However, we realized that there was some unknown emotion hidden behind that feeling, ......and as our hearts raced, we had our hands upon the door. ......That was the exciting age we were at.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, we realized that there was some unknown emotion hidden behind that feeling, ......and as our hearts raced, we had our hands upon the door. That was the exciting age we were at.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、その胸の感触の向こうに、未知の感情があることを気付き、……その扉に、心臓を高鳴らせながら手を掛ける。……そんな、くすぐったい年頃の、少年と少女たちだった。
Russian (RU): Но мы поняли, что за этим чувством скрыта неизвестная эмоция...... и как только наши сердца забились чаще, наши руки оказались на двери. Вот в каком захватывающем возрасте мы были.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas nós percebemos que havia algum tipo de emoção oculta escondida por trás desse sentimento, ......e, conforme nossos corações aceleravam, nós colocamos nossas mãos sobre a porta. ......Esta era a empolgante idade em que estávamos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，他們意識到了，在這種胸中的感覺的另一邊，存在著未知的情感，……邊心臟跳得砰砰響，邊把手伸向了那扇門。……他們就是這麼一對，處於心癢難耐的年齡的，少男與少女。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，他们意识到了，在这种胸中的感觉的另一边，存在着未知的情感，……边心脏跳得砰砰响，边把手伸向了那扇门。……他们就是这么一对，处于心痒难耐的年龄的，少男与少女。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, avevamo capito che c'era una certa emozione sconosciuta nascosta in quel sentimento... e mentre i nostri cuori battevano all'impazzata, avevamo le nostre mani sulla porta. Quella era l'emozionante età in cui ci trovavamo.

Steam (ST): So.
Umineko Project (UP): So.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So.
PC Japanese (JP): だから。
Russian (RU): И так...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi.

Steam (ST): At some point, our discussions about mystery novels became just an excuse for us meeting alone...
Umineko Project (UP): At some point, our discussions about mystery novels became just an excuse for us to spend time alone together...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At some point, our discussions about mystery novels became just an excuse for us meeting alone...
PC Japanese (JP): いつしか、推理小説を巡る議論は、二人きりでの時間の口実となっていた…。
Russian (RU): Обсуждения детективов вдруг стали лишь поводом для встреч наедине...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em determinado momento, as nossas discussões sobre mistérios acabaram se tornando apenas uma desculpa para passarmos algum tempo a sós...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知從何時起，討論推理小說，成了他們兩人找機會獨處的藉口…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知从何时起，讨论推理小说，成了他们两人找机会独处的借口…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ad un certo punto, le nostre discussioni sui gialli divennero solo una scusa per incontrarci di nascosto...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "There aren't many mystery novels that care much about the "why dunnit"."
Umineko Project (UP): "There aren't many mystery novels that care much about the whydunit."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There aren't many mystery novels that care much about the 'why dunnit'."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ホワイダニットを大切にした推理小説って、あまりねぇんだよな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ホワイダニットを大切にした推理小説って、あまりねぇんだよな」
Russian (RU): "Не многие детективы основательно подходят к причине."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não existem muitos romances policiais que se importem com o {i:whydunit}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「基本上沒有注重 whydunit 的推理小說呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「基本上没有注重 whydunit 的推理小说呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non ci sono molte opere che si preoccupano del ‘why dunnit’."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "The "why dunnit"? You mean the culprit's motive...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "The whydunit? You mean the culprit's motive...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The 'why dunnit'? You mean the culprit's motive...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ホワイダニット？　犯人の動機、ですか…？」
Russian (RU): "К причине? В смысле, к мотиву преступника?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{i:Whydunit}? Fala da motivação do culpado...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「Whydunit？是指犯人的動機，麼…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「Whydunit？是指犯人的动机，么…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Il ‘why dunnit’? Intendi le motivazioni del colpevole...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Yeah. There are three points you need to figure out in mystery novels: the "who dunnit", the "how dunnit", and the "why dunnit". A lot of mysteries deal with the first two, but surprisingly few worry about the final one."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah. There are three points you need to figure out in mystery novels: the whodunit, the howdunit, and the whydunit. A lot of mysteries deal with the first two, but surprisingly few worry about the final one."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yeah. There are three points you need to figure out in mystery novels: the 'who dunnit', the 'how dunnit', and the 'why dunnit'. A lot of mysteries deal with the first two, but surprisingly few worry about the final one."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あぁ。推理小説で探るべき３つの論点は、フーダニット、ハウダニット、そして、ホワイダニット。この、前者２つを扱う小説は結構多いと思うが、最後のホワイダニットを扱う小説って、案外ないんだよな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ。推理小説で探るべき３つの論点は、フーダニット、ハウダニット、そして、ホワイダニット。この、前者２つを扱う小説は結構多いと思うが、最後のホワイダニットを扱う小説って、案外ないんだよな」
Russian (RU): "Да. В детективах нужно выяснить три момента: 'кто', 'как' и 'почему'. Многие детективы разделываются с первыми двумя, но, как ни удивительно, мало какие уделяют внимание последнему."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Existem três pontos que você precisa descobrir em um mistério: {i:whodunit}, {i:howdunit} e {i:whydunit}. Muitos mistérios abordam os dois primeiros, mas, por incrível que pareça, poucos se importam com o último."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯。在推理小說中當去探求的 3 個論點，乃是 whodunit、howdunit，還有，whydunit 哦。雖然我覺得，講前兩者的小說挺多的，但講最後的 whydunit 的小說，出人意料地少呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。在推理小说中当去探求的 3 个论点，乃是 whodunit、howdunit，还有，whydunit 哦。虽然我觉得，讲前两者的小说挺多的，但讲最后的 whydunit 的小说，出人意料地少呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Già. Ci sono tre punti che devi scoprire in un giallo: il ‘who dunnit’, il ‘how dunnit’, e il ‘why dunnit’. Molti gialli risolvono i primi due, ma incredibilmente pochi si preoccupano del terzo."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Well, I know about many works that take great care to have the culprit confess his motive after he's been found out..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well, I know about many works that take great care to have the culprit confess his motive after he's found out..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「犯人特定後に動機を自白する作品は、結構あると思いますけど…？」
Russian (RU): "Хотя я знаю много работ, в которых большое внимание уделяют признанию преступника после того, как его вычислили..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, eu conheço muitas obras que fazem um ótimo trabalho elaborando a confissão do culpado e seu motivo, após ter o crime revelado..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不過我倒覺得，在特定出犯人後自白動機的作品並不少哦…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不过我倒觉得，在特定出犯人后自白动机的作品并不少哦…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Beh, conosco molte opere che si preoccupano di far confessare al colpevole le sue motivazioni dopo essere stato scoperto..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "But it has to be something you can reason out before the culprit confesses, or it doesn't count. Personally, I think it's unfair for a person who supposedly didn't have a motive to commit the crime, unless it's possible to reason his or her motive out."
Umineko Project (UP): "But it has to be something that you can reason out before the culprit confesses, or it doesn't count. When the culprit is someone who didn't appear to have a motive, and they commit the crime for reasons that are impossible to deduce, personally, I think that's unfair."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "But it has to be something that you can reason out before the culprit confesses, or it doesn't count. Personally, I think it's unfair for a person who supposedly didn't have a motive to commit the crime, unless it's possible to reason his or her motive out."
PC Japanese (JP): 「それを、犯人が自白する前に推理できるようになってなけりゃ駄目なんだ。動機がないと思われていた人物が、推理不能な動機により事件に及ぶってのは、俺は個人的にはアンフェアだと思ってる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それを、犯人が自白する前に推理できるようになってなけりゃ駄目なんだ。動機がないと思われていた人物が、推理不能な動機により事件に及ぶってのは、俺は個人的にはアンフェアだと思ってる」
Russian (RU): "Но должна быть возможность вычислить мотив до того, как преступник сознается, а иначе это не в счёт. Лично я считаю, что не давать вычислить причину мотива несправедливо по отношению к тому, у кого якобы не было причин совершать преступление."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mas precisa ser algo que você possa deduzir antes do culpado confessar, ou não vai contar. Quando o culpado é alguém que não aparenta ter um motivo e comete um crime por motivos que são impossíveis de se deduzir, pessoalmente, eu acho isso bem injusto."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「動機，若不能在犯人自白前就推理出來，就不算。本以為沒有動機的人物，因無法推理的動機而犯案，我個人覺得，這並不公平。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「动机，若不能在犯人自白前就推理出来，就不算。本以为没有动机的人物，因无法推理的动机而犯案，我个人觉得，这并不公平。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ma deve essere qualcosa che puoi capire prima della confessione, o non ha senso. Personalmente, credo che non sia giusto nei confronti di una persona che in teoria non avrebbe motivo di compiere il crimine, a meno che non sia possibile ricavarsi da soli le sue ragioni."

Steam (ST): "Who dunnit". Who's the culprit? "How dunnit". How did he commit the crime? "Why dunnit". Why did he commit the crime?
Umineko Project (UP): "Whodunit". Who's the culprit?{n}"Howdunit". How did they commit the crime?{n}"Whydunit". Why did they commit the crime?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 'Who dunnit'. Who's the culprit?'How dunnit'. How did he commit the crime?'Why dunnit'. Why did he commit the crime?
PC Japanese (JP): フーダニット。誰が犯人か。ハウダニット。どうやって犯行を。ホワイダニット。どうして犯行を。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): フーダニット。誰が犯人か。{n}ハウダニット。どうやって犯行を。{n}ホワイダニット。どうして犯行を。
Russian (RU): 'Кто'. Кто преступник?{n}'Как'. Как он совершил преступление?{n}'Почему'. Почему он совершил преступление?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{i:Whodunit}". Quem é o culpado?{n}"{i:Howdunit}". Como ele cometeu o crime?{n}"{i:Whydunit}". Por que ele cometeu o crime?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): Whodunit。誰是犯人。{n}Howdunit。怎麼犯的案。{n}Whydunit。為什麼要犯案。
Chinese Simplified (CN): Whodunit。谁是犯人。{n}Howdunit。怎么犯的案。{n}Whydunit。为什么要犯案。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ‘Who dunnit’. Chi è il colpevole? ‘How dunnit’. In che modo ha commesso il delitto? ‘Why dunnit’. Per quale motivo l'ha fatto?

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "There are a ton of works that ask about who the culprit is, and what tricks they used. In fact, almost all are like that. However, I don't think there are many novels that ask you to figure out the motive."
Umineko Project (UP): "Who the culprit is, and what tricks they used... There are a ton of works that ask you to figure that out. In fact, almost all are like that. However, I don't think there are many novels that ask you to figure out the motive."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "There are a ton of works that ask about who the culprit is, and what tricks they used. In fact, almost all are like that. However, I don't think there are many novels that ask you to figure out the motive."
PC Japanese (JP): 「誰が犯人かとか、どんなトリックでとか。それを問う作品はすげぇ多いぜ。いや、ほとんどだろうな。しかし、動機を推理する作品ってのは、決して多くないと思う。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「誰が犯人かとか、どんなトリックでとか。それを問う作品はすげぇ多いぜ。いや、ほとんどだろうな。しかし、動機を推理する作品ってのは、決して多くないと思う」
Russian (RU): "Есть тонны работ, в которых спрашивается о том, кто преступник и какие трюки он провернул. Вообще они почти все такие. Но я не думаю, что есть много романов, в которых просят вычислить мотив."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Quem é o culpado, quais truques ele usou... Existe uma série de trabalhos que pedem que você descubra isso. Na verdade, quase todos são assim. Mas não acho que existam tantos livros que pesam a você para descobrir o motivo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「誰是犯人呀，用了怎樣的詭計呀。有好多好多問這些的作品。不，幾乎全都是吧。可推理動機的作品，我想絕對不算多。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谁是犯人呀，用了怎样的诡计呀。有好多好多问这些的作品。不，几乎全都是吧。可推理动机的作品，我想绝对不算多。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ci sono moltissime opere che dicono chi sia il colpevole, e che trucco abbia usato. Infatti, sono quasi tutti così. Tuttavia, non credo che ci siano molti romanzi che ti chiedono di scoprire il perché."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Good point. That might be the most neglected of the three."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Good point. That might be the most neglected of the three."
